attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make it so any employer has to reply to job applications within a month.
attributes.background: Applying for a job and getting no reply is demoralising and can leave you unmotivated to apply for others. If you get no reply, you’re unsure if your CV is bad or if they’re ignoring your application. Therefore, employers should reply to applications within a certain amount of time.
attributes.additional_details: If you’re told that you’re not accepted, then it will help significantly more than being told nothing, as you can then build on your CV / application technique. But when you’re ignored, then you don’t know what is wrong and when it happens with every job you apply for it can seriously damage motivation to apply for more. Therefore I feel it is a right that an applicant reserves; to get a reply - wether it be a yes or no or simply that the role is now fulfilled.

attributes.action: Change the long assessment format for people with M.E, which causes them stress
attributes.background: The payment for PIP for people with ME can take up to four months and every year they answer the same questions. ME is a condition that affect someone’s whole life or it can a short term illness of fatigue.  People who have ME are not all able to travel to hospitals for assessments, change is needed
attributes.additional_details: The stress of PIP assessment I have witnessed first hand, the process is too long and to have the assessment every year is unfair. That person’s health may not be any different since the year before. PIP needs to be considered being kept and not keep changing to another system, so that these people don’t have to worry about financial issues or become ill because of the long assessments and worry.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Make UK taxpayers' salary and tax searchable and revealable to other taxpayers
attributes.background: Making taxpayers' salary revealable to other taxpayers is achievable with our digital tax system. Openness about salary and tax paid can act to reduce the gap between boardroom and shop-floor pay, gender pay gap and tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details: Any taxpayers whose salary is searched for and revealed will be able to see the name and ref number of the taxpayer who their salary and tax totals have been revealed to. This reduces spurious usage and makes it equitable in that the searcher's salary can be searched for too. Inequality thrives in dark corners, make salary and taxation more open in the UK!

attributes.action: Scrap the government’s plan of building HS2 and build a Hyperloop system instead
attributes.background: Instead of spending billions of pounds of taxpayer’s money on a system that will take so long to complete that it will already be antiquated, the government should invest in a Hyperloop system, reducing journey times exponentially, with speeds of up to 700mph. Manchester to London in 18 minutes!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2017/08/26/britains-hyperloop-pipe-dream-meet-people-behind-uks-futuristic/

http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/hyperloop-one-richard-branson-virgin-investment-london-scotland-transport-travel-fast-a7998106.html

https://hyperloop-one.com

attributes.action: Amend TUA 2016, so non-union members pay for benefits gained from Union work.
attributes.background:
Benefits negotiated by Trade unions at the workplace are enjoyed by union members & non-members alike.
e.g. Workplace offers 1% pay rise to workforce but through negotiations with trade union, an increased offer of 2.5% is agreed. Members & non-members alike are given a 2.5% pay rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Union members already make financial contribution to support their union to act on their behalf however non-members receive the benefit of this rise without having made any financial contribution to the costs of the union achieving this mutually beneficially outcome.
Make non-union members pay monthly contribution, not exceeding subs paid by union members or they will receive only the 1% payrise.

attributes.action: Increase funding and awareness for public transport in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is well known for being a modern and developed nation, but do we really do all that we can to make our country green? We are falling behind compared to many other countries. This directly affects everyone in the UK so take our country's future into your hands; sign now to have your say.

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: Add ‘RESPECT’ to the National Curriculum from 5 years upwards. Lacking Today.
attributes.background:
Many grow up with little or no respect today, no Respect for Teachers the Police, Property and the Elderly, this is very wrong in this day and age, Some Police only Get Cheek in trying to correct their behaviour and the ones above.

At one time Churches could leave them open, today it’s a No No.
attributes.additional_details:
Many youngsters are Serious Lacking Any Respect today as is Proven, Some attack Teachers and their Assistants, Elderly getting abused and Picked on, when I was young it was Instilled into us ALL at school Never to do Anything Against the Elderly and all the above, we All Respected Them 100%, we would never have thought about causing Damage or Thefts from Churches, today some do, Not all are Bad just a Select few causing Antisocial Behaviour.

Let’s try to correct things and make the Country good

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killers
attributes.background: Codeine is a drug that is sold without prescription in the UK. It is used by drug addicted in order to “get high” in big dosage, which is equal to what’s contained in one pack (30 tablets). It is banned for opened sale in US, Germany, Japan and Australia.

attributes.action: Ban vans parking and blocking views of crossings&driveways
attributes.background: Van drivers don’t realise that parking where they do can cause view of drivers pulling off of driveways and people waiting to cross and bus stops etc

attributes.action: Scrap or Re-evaluate Hazard Perception
attributes.background:
The 'hazard perception' part of UK theory tests is one of the most hated parts of becoming a learner driver. 
The hazard perception part is taken on a computer, where you click the screen when you see a developing hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
The problem with this part of the theory test is that you have to spot 'developing hazards', and if you spot a hazard 'too early' you do not get the marks. Put this into real life, spotting a hazard too early? The entire marking scheme is pathetic. 
I do not disagree with the idea however, as spotting hazards is essential for safe driving. The hazard perception should be incorporated in the practical test and marked by an examiner, someone able to think, and not a computer.

attributes.action: Replace credit card commission to businesses with flat fees per transaction
attributes.background: The government announced recently that businesses are no longer able to charge commission on credit card payments. However, credit card companies can still levy commission on businesses. This is damaging to many businesses, especially as commissions vary, so we must introduce fixed fees instead.
attributes.additional_details:
More people will use a credit card rather than a debit card now there is no commission to pay. This is to be expected, after all, the money is better in their account for a month, but the cost to business is unjust.
The cost for debit card transactions is around 15p per transaction. 
For £100,000 worth of transactions at an average of £50, this would equate to £300. 
For credit cards this could be between £1,500 and £2,000. There is no justification for such excess so please help to stop it.

attributes.action: Referenda enacted by a UK nation must allow citizens born in that nation a vote.
attributes.background: If a UK nation considers a referendum about independence from the union, or a related topic that affects the stability of that union, then voters born in that nation, and who are citizens of the UK residing within the UK, must be able to vote on the referendum topic.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Independence Referendum of 2014 refused the vote to citizens of the UK born in Scotland, but who resided in another nation of the UK. Since this would likely impact their citizenship (stateless?) and ability to work, they should be able to vote.

This is a general petition, and is not specific to a future Scottish Referendum. Any citizen of the UK, born in a UK nation (Northern Ireland, Wales, Scotland, England) where their birth-Nation has a referendum, should be able to vote.

attributes.action: The UK to urge the UN to add Catalonia as a non-self-governing territory.
attributes.background: The UN charter defines a Non-Self-Governing Territory (NSGT) as one “whose people have not yet attained a full measure of self-government”. Given the recent actions of the Spanish regime, as permanent member of the UNSC the UK should urge that Catalonia be added to the NSGT list maintained by the UN
attributes.additional_details: Catalonia has a unique language, culture and ethnicity. Between 1930 and 1970 Spain as a state committed various violent repressions on the Catalonians and restricted their culture, language and identity. The Spanish terrorists who did this were formally pardoned by Madrid. Currently the Catalonians are expressing their right to self-determination through a peaceful referendum, which has been violently banned by the Spanish regime.

attributes.action: Give equal survivor pension benefits to widows and widowers of female teachers.
attributes.background: Men and women have always paid equal contributions into the teachers' pension scheme. However, widowers of women teachers continue to receive lower amounts than widows of men teachers. The DfE recently announced that spouses / civil partners of same-sex couples will receive equal benefits to widows.
attributes.additional_details:
The bereaved spouses of teachers receive different levels of pension benefits, depending on gender and sexual orientation. Men married to women are disadvantaged compared to those in all other legal relationships. Survivors receive 50% of their partner's pension accrued since 1972. However, only contributions since 1988 count towards survivor benefits for the husbands of female teachers. 
See: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/occupational-pension-schemes-review-of-survivor-benefits

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: Fund PTSD recovery centres for ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel
attributes.background:
Thousands of ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel have been diagnosed with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and depression.
This trauma causes flashbacks, nightmares, anger and depression - often leading to violence, alcohol and substance abuse, job loss, family breakdown and suicide.
attributes.additional_details: We aim to set up a number of PTSD “Front line” recovery centres around the country offering horticultural and other therapeutic treatments specifically aimed at helping to re-habilitate ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel and help them to come to terms with their illness and move on. We plan to arrange a meeting with members of the government and opposition parties to obtain cross party support for this project and ask for £6 million to help fund its start up.

attributes.action: Scrap the make taxation digital regulations for all business below £100k profit
attributes.background: The make tax digital regulations deliver no benefits to either HMRC or small business, especially those on cash accounting or low profit business. The additional burden will inevitably close or damage many business', &  the economy so the best solution would be to scrap it before it is too late
attributes.additional_details: The making tax digital regulations are fundamentally flawed and failed to take note of the consultation warnings of the impact they would have on in particular small business's, so instead of running a parallel trial where the uptake would be voluntary they have instead opted for closure of business and damage to the economy. Therefore the only safe solution is to scrap these for low profit business and make it voluntary instead so that those who see benefits can & others continue to file online

attributes.action: refund 2 months Road tax for every car driver, due to the amount of pot holes
attributes.background: We are paying road tax for roads that are not fit for us to drive on and this is causing damage to our vehicles and the cost lies with us the tax payer to repair our cars. if you are paying for a service the service that you are paying for sure be suitable and not value for money.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to address this situation I believe that the government should reduce the amount of road tax for next year as compensation or give back the equivalent of two months road tax to every car owner in the country.

If you paid for any of the service that wasn't fit for purpose you will be able to claim a refund why is this not the same with our Road tax

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: Improve mental healthcare provisions available for prisoners
attributes.background: Levels of mental health conditions amongst prisoners are disproportionately high compared to those in society.  Despite this, provisions available for prisoners are lacking and the prison environment itself can be a driving force which exacerbates a mental health condition opposed to combatting it.
attributes.additional_details:
90% of prisoners experience some form of mental health condition whilst in prison (Singleton et al., 1998) and acute disorders such as psychosis are extremely high (Bebbington et al., 2016).  Suicide and self harm rates are at an all time high (Fazel et al., 2017).
Whilst HMPPS and the NHS alongside the department of health provide "in reach teams" to help those suffering from a mental health condition, more needs to be done.

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Introduce Emotional Assistance Pet Act to prevent suicides and help families!
attributes.background:
The legislation that allows the emotional support animal access in housing facilities, even when the complex has a no pet policy already exists in the US. So literally we are not discovering an America here.
The petition is simply a trigger for Parliament to introduce it into the UK legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
It is known that the highest rates of suicide are associated with depressive disorders. 

The human-animal emotional bond does not differ from the one that we sustain in relation to close family members i.e. our own children.

There is also Article 8 of the Human Rights Act that provides the right to respect for one’s established family life (no pre-determined model of a family or family life)

Being cut off from your pet (family member) is increasing the risk of depression.
http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for vendors to produce a Home Survey prior to marketing
attributes.background:
I paid for 1 survey & vendors withdrew from market
Paid for survey on 2nd house & found pure asbestos
Paid for survey on 3rd house & found structural movement
Paid for survey to buy 4th house
And other buyers will also have to pay for surveys on those same houses.

attributes.action: Lower the math entry requirement to a Grade D, to access teacher training.
attributes.background: Many Passionate individuals like myself are not able to access teacher training courses due to receiving a grade D at GCSE level. This is creating a problem of shortages of teachers, since many are simply not able to active peruse their dreams in helping the younger generation achieve their best.
attributes.additional_details: Why would you need math to teach English, Sociology or other non math based/ limited math courses. It seems that achieving a Grade D in math at GCSE portrays the idea that we cannot do math. This is absolutely absurd, just because people did not achieve a grade C or above does not mean we cannot do the basic math. I simply believe, to become a teacher within the UK, math should only be a requirement depending on the type of Course the individual would like to teach.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Remove defensive architecture to help homeless people sleep safely
attributes.background: We undersign our HM Government to make it illegal for businesses and local communities to have defensive architecture on their buildings and benches. This is so that homeless people can have somewhere to sleep safely at night, without being harmed

attributes.action: Public enquiry into child sexual abuse and exportation in Cleveland
attributes.background: Cleveland police have investigated child sexual abuse and exploitation with little result. I believe many more people should have been charged and many people were too scared to come forward. The impact of this has devastated many people and even led to drug and alcohol problems.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and farming of non-free range eggs.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition as I feel it is wrong to farm eggs in factories then sell them as the eggs are not healthy but also the chicken who creates the eggs is tortured and pumped with chemicals and I feel this is wrong.

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Stop asking schools to check the right to work for parents on school visits
attributes.background: Parents accompanying off site visits with schools are classed as volunteers. All workers voluntary or otherwise must have their right to work checked. This requirement for checks involves schools taking a copy of a passport and signing and dating to say it represents the parent.
attributes.additional_details: I am Headteacher in a busy primary school and neither I nor my office staff have time for unnecessary work. This requirement to check adds an additional admin burden for people who in goodwill are supporting the work of the school on a casual and irregular basis. Accompanying off site visits does not constitute work and will not lead to employment. Parents of children who attend a state funded school must have the right to work and residence or their children will not get a place in school.

attributes.action: Change the law to protect parental contributions for house purchase on divorce
attributes.background: 1000s of parents are donating money to their son or daughter’s house purchases. Parents are providing part or all of the large deposits required in today’s inflated UK housing market. Currently there is no law protecting these funds in the event of a divorce and the Government needs to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Families are providing funds believing this money will stay with their children or indeed their grandchildren further down the line in the event of a divorce. This is not the case. Declaration of Trusts or similar deeds are ignored by judges and the non-contributing partner is wrongly benefitting.
Legal protection is needed to stop these contributions and inheritances disappearing from the original families.

attributes.action: End Child Maintenance for Shared care parents.
attributes.background: As it currently stands the resident parent can claim Child Maitanence from the other parent based on how many nights they stay with them. For example up to 57 nights per year is what the child maintanence service class as shared care but still the non resident parent has to pay maintanence.
attributes.additional_details: As an example I have a shared care arrangement with my daughters mum who has residency with them, they stay with me Wednesday - Saturday 7.30pm week 1 & Thursday - Saturday 7.30pm week 2. When they are with me they have everything they need E.g own school clothes, daily clothes, footwear Etc. Their mum claims child benefit & child tax credits for them and yet Child Maintanence Service (CMS) still claim I should still be paying more money to their mum. End the Equality for non resident parents!

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: HMG to advise Her Majesty to remove “Royal” from Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
attributes.background: On the Prime Minister’s advice, Wootton Basset was awarded the title “Royal” as a result of it's dedicated action. If this honour can be awarded it can also be removed. This should apply to Kensington and Chelsea as a result of the action prior to and inaction following the Grenfell Tower tragedy.
attributes.additional_details: It is an affront to British values for Kensington and Chelsea to continue to use the title “Royal”. The council leader has resigned. Responsibility for Grenfell Tower residents has been taken away from the council by HM Government. A public inquiry has been ordered by HM Government.

attributes.action: Publish clearer guidance about speed limits for Vans as they are currently wrong
attributes.background:
The Road Traffic Act 1988 section 185 , 1 (b) defines the majority of van's currently on the road as a "motor car".

So schedule 6 speed limits do not apply to the majority of Vans.

I believe your guidance on Car-derived vans and dual purpose vehicles portray's incorrect speed limits for van's
attributes.additional_details:
Please see important website information and other petitions

http://bentcop.boards.net/thread/160/petition-government-clarity-speed-limits

attributes.action: A UK wide once in a generation special Public Holiday to clear the UK of Litter
attributes.background: I would like to propose a once in a generation special public holiday to get everyone outside with recycled bin bags & litter pickers to help clear & tidy up their local areas from the unsightly litter that we all come across from day to day but never have the time to do it.  The UK is beautiful!
attributes.additional_details: Since I was a child I always remember thinking why do people throw their litter out of cars or discard it whilst walking.  It is something that I really feel strongly about. so what can I do about it?  I could spend my time endlessly picking after people. Or better still encourage everyone to do it!

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage
